data.title: You will not be disappoined
data.text: This my wife's and my "go to place" in Scranton.  Great service, gourmet food, reasonable prices and classic ambiance.  You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Good service
data.text: While traveling with friends, my husband and I suggested this restaurant for a late lunch. My husband ordered the yellow fin tuna, I had a burger we were both happy with our selections. Our friends ordered a variety of dishes, everyone said we made a good choice with this restaurant. I thought the service was particularly good, our waitress was particularly patient and helpful.

data.title: Wonderful steak
data.text:
Friends took us to this restaurant while we were visiting Scranton and our meal was very good. My filet was among the best I've had. The friends recommended that we order sides to be shared and that proved to be a good idea. My favorite was the mushrooms and onions but the creamed spinach and asparagus were also very good. I had lemon lush for dessert and it was yummy.

My only complaint was that our service was slow. Other tables with different wait staff seemed to receive faster service so our waiter may have been distracted. The food was good enough to compensate for the slow service.

data.title: Good food, a tad pricey
data.text: We visited on a Friday night about 8:30. They were pretty dead but we had made reservations just in case. We got bread and butter served on the house first. I then ordered a martini and my bf ordered a beer. They were pricey, the martini was 10.50. We ordered a crab cake as an appetizer which was OK at best. I ordered the hangar steak @ $25 and cooked medium..was cooked perfectly but was under seasoned. My bf ordered the ribeye at $50 , it was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. Then we had a creme brulee for dessert. The sugar topping was over torched causing it to be more like a rock candy type texture and you could taste the char. Service was pretty good, offered refills, was friendly etc. There really isn't parking other than a paid lot next to it.

data.title: Visiting Family in Scranton, PA
data.text: My boyfriend and I just had the porterhouse steak for two, and we were pleasantly blown away. Ordered a side of Bearnaise sauce to go with it, but ended up barely putting any on the steak since it was awesome enough on its own. We loved our server, and the rest of my family enjoyed their dinners as well. We plan on stopping here again when we're back in Scranton for future family visits.

data.title: If you are heading to Scranton.....
data.text: Forget Joe Biden......visit this place!  Fantastic service!  The prime t bone was cooked perfectly.  Scallops with thick slices of bacon was delicious. The tomatoes, onions and blue cheese with Luger sauces was great. Right near University of Scranton.  Worth the trip!

data.title: Friday night in the city
data.text:
Looking for a dinner spot in downtown Scranton within walking distance of the hotel.  Chose this as much due to proximity as food type.

Seated promptly.  On a hot summer night, the air conditioning felt good.  Clearly this restaurant is known for their steaks, but after asking if the veal was good, I chose veal medallions with blue cheese on recommendation of our waiter Brian.

Brian's service and manner were impeccable.  It was a pleasurable dining experience and the food was tender and fresh.  Chicken piccata and veal were delicious.

This restaurant is definitely worth a return visit!

data.title: Way better when "Great Uncle Petes"
data.text: Took the family to owners new location and very disappointed across the board.  Actually wife and I felt ill after leaving.  We traveled more than an hour to experience what we knew at former restaurant in Clark Summit and will never be back again.

data.title: Great. Not Super
data.text: Most entrees were good      Bread great!  Deserts good.   Service excellent!  Somewhat pricey for Scranton.   Nice atmosphere.  Bar menu is great and cocktails were excellent

data.title: Best Rib Eye steak EVER
data.text: Truly the place to go for steaks. And dessert was top as well. Scallops were delish, though could have been crisper on top layer and not buried into a garlic mash. Appetizers yummy, crab cakes were 'insane' to quote my man. Waitstaff attentive and friendly. Sat outside for sunset, umbrellas could be adjusted for comfort from rays. Drink menu was impressive.

data.title: Worst Experience (I meant to give half a star review)
data.text: Me and my friend stopped by Carl Von Luger's the early on Sunday afternoon before Memorial Day. Upon entering the restaurant me and my friend (we're a mixed-couple of African and Latino ancestry) seeing customers already seated dining inside at tables and outside on the patio. The waitress started to seat us when the owner (a balding, portly man dressed in a suit giving orders) interrupted stopping her in her tracks) telling her and us that a private party of 53 had booked the venue previously and they were unable to serve us that day because of graduations. I accepted that and we went across the street and ate at Abe's Kosher Delicatessen(which was great by the way!) After finishing eating at Abe's returning to our car in the same direction I became suspicious seeing customers still eating on the patio coming in and out of the restaurant. I decided to see what the real situation was and went back asking another waitress if we could get a table?  She said, "Yes" and immediately began to seat us. The same man in the suit stopped out again and we asked about the graduation and he came up with another flimsy story why we couldn't be seated earlier saying something to the effect he couldn't be sure what was happening that day. There were plenty of open table space there on both occasions that we were there and asked to be seated (we were well-dressed also.) Though I'm not one to immediately pull the race card every chance I can this situation really stinks all the way around. I've read other reviews about the venue which seems to corroborate his personality and overall attitude with the public. I'm glad we didn't get to eat there. Save your money and go to eat at POSH or at the Radisson downtown where they treat you better...

data.title: Amazing Chefs!
data.text: My first time at this restaurant. After looking over the menu online, it definitely has a variety of seafood, steaks, salads and everything in between. My friend and I ordered the house made fried mozzarella, mussels, and the house made fresh mozzarella, served with tomato and roasted red peppers. Delicious! Sous Chef Timmy and Executive Chef Mike made a personal appearance to my table to great me and ask me how my food was. Great atmosphere to go for lunch during the work week or have a nice night out. Keep up the great work!

data.title: Great Steakhouse in the heart of Scranton
data.text: Great food and cocktails...We booked our party of 15 at least a month ahead of time as we wanted our our space which was available.  The restaurant itself is small and although an expensive dining restaurant some patrons were dressed very casually. We were celebrating our son's college graduation and we dressed for the special occasion. This is nice restaurant and guests should be dressed nicely.  We all ordered the filet, cooked to perfection for each of us. The owner came into our room several time and was attentive.  We also had great service with an exceptional wait service who was also very attentive.  Cocktails were delicious! We booked a fixed menu which offered 4 choices and several options for appetizers, which the restaurant was happy to change for us based on what we wanted instead of what they offered.  We also brought our own cake which the restaurant charges a 1.00 platting fee.  Overall a great dining experience...Seating outside as well although weather didn't permit.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Fantastic food.  The steak was cooked to perfection and the sides were outstanding.  The horse radish cream sauce was out of the world and the pino noir we had was great.  staff was on top of their game.

data.title: Chicken marsala, missing marsala
data.text: Went for dinner with a large group.  Service was great. Food is expensive. Shrimp appetizers were big and cooked nice. I ordered chicken marsala, but it did not have any marsala in the sauce. It was a brown gravy, way to thick.  The bartender told us they do not have marsala wine and did not know why they have chicken marsala on the menu! Dissapointed. Pretty atmosphere, outdoor seating, clean, but very expensive. Better places around to spend money on a better meal.

data.title: Great every time
data.text: I've yet to have a bad meal and have been here numerous times. Make sure to have reservations because it can be fairly busy.

data.title: Great lunch with friends
data.text: Had an enjoyable lunch, service was wonderful, owner was very attentive, clean, quiet atmosphere. The lunch specials are always good. Highly recommend.

data.title: Excellent For The Steak Lover!
data.text: If you enjoy a super steak, this is your place when near Scranton! Also, delicious appitizers ! Nice to sit outside on a spring or summer evening!

data.title: Great Steaks
data.text: As good as any steak you will find in NYC. Been there with my wife and in a group service was very good also.

data.title: Great steak indeed
data.text: My wife and I went there for our anniversary, the menu was simple but full of great choices, and there was a great special menu as well. Although the service was a bit under par the food was delightful, the martinis were awesome and the aged beef was some of the best. The atmosphere wasn't as nice as I was hoping for a romantic dinner because of some louder guest that possible had one to many but that could happen anywhere.
